selection_reasoning: Generation 4 successfully broke the 2.630 barrier using a force-directed cooling schedule (trial_4_1). I am selecting this new leader along with the most successful historical methods (trial_2_2, trial_1_1) and two diverse strategies (basin-hopping and circle-reinsertion) to ensure both exploitation of the current best topology and exploration of new ones.

trial_selections.reasoning: New overall best (2.6302). The force-directed cooling schedule is the most effective method so far for finding high-quality seeds.
Previous best (2.6299). It remains a strong and diverse baseline for force-directed methods.
Basin-hopping approach. While it didn't set a record, global search methods are necessary to avoid getting stuck in the current 2.630 plateau.
The circle-reinsertion logic provides a mechanism for discrete topological changes, which is a different search dimension than continuous optimization.
The best hexagonal-grid based approach. It provides a different structural starting point compared to the force-directed methods.
